answers.answer: It is great to hear a positive story!I too found a great neuro whou actually listens. I hope you get a real DX soon!I wish you all the best!Take Care, Theresa

question: Hey Guys!I saw my new neuo yesterday, and he was great!  Gave him my sx list, and he actually started reading it, and asking me ?'s about it.  He took me very seriously, was concerned because he said I have alot of complaints, on top of my other problems(diabetes fibro, lupus etc).  Anyway, he of course wants to eliminate all of the mimics. Spoke to him about how my new rheumy thinks the Lupus might be a misdiagnosis.  Because of the IBS problems, wants to make sure I don't also have celiac disease, sending me for an eng, I guess because of the vertigo. another mri of the brain, neck, and thoracic area,(never had that one done before).  Told him about the buzzing, vibrating head, was very concerned.   Sending me for some king of computer test for the memory,problem solving, and cog issues.  And also a dextra bone scan because I'm diabetic, so incase I need steroids.and also had a complete hysterectomy.  I think that's what he said.  Also last but not least, a sleep study, cause I snore really bad, and I'm still sleeping on the recliner because of all the muscle pain.  I don't get much sleep.  Not tooo excited about the sleep study.  I like to watch tv before I fall asleep, and I have to get up so many times a nite to use the bathroon. Said will probable do LP after all other testing doneSo today I see my new Rheumy for the results of lab work, about the Lupus and other things.  I'll keep you posted.  I'm starting to see the little nite light at the end of the tunnel. A DIAGNOSIS!   No matter what the dx is I need something so I can start to treat it.   I asked him, so what do you think doc about the ms do you have any ideas yet.  He said, "Well if it looks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, It's probably a duck, but we have to rule everything else out".  I said I couldn't agree more.   Anyway I'll let you know what happens as it happens.  Thanks for listening!    Hugs!   Sandie
title: A NEURO WHO KNOWS WHAT HE WANTS
